meanings.definition: The skin covering the top of the human head
meanings.sent1: Her scalp felt warm in the sun.
meanings.sent2: He gently scratched his scalp to relieve an itch.
meanings.sent3: The scalp protected her head from the cold wind.
meanings.sent4: The scalp was like a shield against the harsh elements.
meanings.sent5: She massaged her scalp to relax after a long day.

meanings.definition: To remove the scalp of (someone) as a trophy or sign of victory
meanings.sent1: The warrior would scalp his enemies after battle.
meanings.sent2: The pirate threatened to scalp the captured sailors.
meanings.sent3: In the movie, the villain would scalp his victims for power.
meanings.sent4: The act of scalping was seen as a brutal display of dominance.
meanings.sent5: The scalp was taken as a gruesome token of triumph.

meanings.definition: To resell tickets for (an event) at a price higher than the official price
meanings.sent1: He decided to scalp the concert tickets for extra cash.
meanings.sent2: Scalping tickets is illegal in many places.
meanings.sent3: The scalper made a profit by scalping the event passes.
meanings.sent4: She regretted scalping the tickets when she saw the disappointed fans.
meanings.sent5: The scalped tickets were sold at exorbitant prices.
